title: Fumaric acid
summary: Fumaric acid is an organic compound with the formula HO2CCH=CHCO2H. A white solid, fumaric acid occurs widely in nature.  It has a fruit-like taste and has been used as a food additive. Its E number is E297.[3] The salts and esters are known as fumarates.  Fumarate can also refer to the C4H2O2âˆ’4 ion (in solution). Fumaric acid is the trans isomer of butenedioic acid, while maleic acid is the cis isomer.
